answers.answer: "I am a type II diabetic and I also have some heart issues"There is not enough information in your post to draw a clear conclusion. If you haven't made the necessary lifestyle changes to help control and manage these health issues a visit to your doctor may uncover some underlying disease. Sudden fatigue has many reasons. Several are:Thyroid issuesHeart failure from high blood pressure or by uncontrolled diabetesNerve disordersKidney or liver issuesUnbalanced diet, even lack of sleepIf I were you, I would be calling my doctor tomorrow for a complete health evaluation which includes full heart testing. Good luck.
Im feeling exactly as you described.I hope you have had positive improvements.What was the diagnosis, and what was done to treat your symptoms?

question: Several times in the last few days I have suddenly lost all energy. Literally one minute fine the next I feel like a hit an energy wall. All I want to do is lay down and sleep. I can hardly walk, I even cannot think straight sometimes. It feels like I would expect a car engine gets when it suddenly does not get enough gas.I am a type II diabetic and I also have some heart issues and I take the following meds: Atenolol 50mg x 2, Lipitor 40mg x 1, Lisoprinil, and aspirin.Has anyone experienced anything like this? Any help would be good.
title: Sudden Energy Loss
